input_text:
Job Title: Manager of Applications

Location: Golden, CO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Management, Project Management

Description:
The Manager of Applications at Mines advances a responsive, customer-centric delivery agenda by leading the Applications team in providing the high-quality IT services required to support Mines' mission and delight end-users.
The Manager of Applications is one of two managers on the Applications Services team; one focuses on academic applications and the other on business applications. Our current opening is for academic applications. This position will lead the team dedicated to the implementation, enhancement, and administration (e.g., interface development/support, application administration, application single sign-on/multi-factor authentication, security administration) for mission-critical academic applications.
The ideal candidate for this role has excellent team and people management skills. We need a strong leader with solid technical skills as this position will lead a team of 6-8 professionals in reaching lofty goals in the modernization of Mines systems. We're moving to the cloud, recently brought on a new data warehouse, just transitioned to Workday and Okta, and have more on the horizon as we continue to build out top-flight solutions within the department. This position requires IT savvy but equally important are interpersonal, negotiating, and consensus-building skills and the ability to work effectively in a diverse environment that values independent thought.
IT at Mines values collaboration, teamwork, seamless access, and work-life balance. They deliver value to the Mines community by aligning the work they do with the institution's strategic goals and they are committed to customer service and protecting Mines by incorporating best-in-class security in their work. For more about the team and the exciting work of this integral department, visit: https://it.mines.edu/.
This is a hybrid position. The Manager of Applications must be able to commute to campus in Golden, Colorado at least twice per week.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Direct, coordinate, and manage applications and technical activities, to ensure the security, integrity, availability, and privacy of Mines academic application resources. Coordinate with vendors and other IT teams to ensure high availability of all academic applications. These applications must be available 24x7 (or as needed) with little or no downtime. Examples of work might include:Identify errors in applications; working with campus departments, vendors and other IT teams to resolve them in a speedy manner.Facilitate implementation of application patches and upgrades.Lead escalations with vendors and ensure vendor Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are met.Work with academic departments in the identification and implementation of fixes/enhancements to existing data integrations or the development of new data integrations.Apply, audit, and enforce internal and external security policies and procedures as appropriate.
Team Management and SupervisionManage a team of application administrators and integrations developers, including prioritizing and assigning work to support the university’s Student Information System (Ellucian Banner SaaS Student), Canvas LMS, Slate Student CRM, Kaltura Video Content Management, and all other integrated systems.Lead, mentor, and coach the team, and identify and enact practices that allow the team to continue to grow the IT vision, mission, and purpose of delivering consistent and impactful services to Mines.Plan, prioritize, assign, analyze and monitor service ticket resolution, maintain appropriate resource assignments, and review progress to ensure the quality and quantity of work meets standards, deadlines for deliverables, and program goals and objectives.Identify training and developmental needs and provide training to develop skills.Recruit, retain, and develop top talent focused on delivering high-quality products, services, and solutions.Actively participate in team meetings with the Senior Director of Application Services and as part of the IT Extended Leadership Team (ITLT+).
New Product ImplementationDirect, coordinate, and manage team activities in the implementation of new campus applications to meet Mines' changing needs.Direct, coordinate, or deliver, as appropriate, new, or advanced services according to established policies, procedures, and plans, and assist in planning for continuing services.
Outreach and CommunicationsCommunicate frequently with the various teams and stakeholders engaged in supporting our enterprise applications including database administration, business intelligence and data management, application solutions development & integration, and business systems functional support. Communications include project updates, system availability updates, and ticket updates.Ensure ticket resolution, keep projects moving forward, and deliver expected results.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree from a four-year college or university in business, computer science, IT management/administration, instructional/educational technology, or equivalent advanced technical training and experience. Individuals without a related degree may be considered if they demonstrate possession of the same knowledge level found in a degree but have attained advanced knowledge through a combination of work experience and intellectual instruction using a 1:1 substitution.5 or more years of experience as an application administrator or developer.1 or more years of experience managing an applications teamSignificant and progressive system administration and application software experience including experience as a lead administrator on major application projects. Experience must include:Broad range of academic applications knowledgeDemonstrated ability to lead a team to diagnose and resolve technical problemsProven ability to manage resources and successfully implement large and small projects.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSEducation environment experienceITIL CertificationAgile CertificationKnowledge of Banner SIS and Degree WorksExperience working with other Ellucian products (Ethos, Experience, etc.)Experience with Workday
SALARY AND TOTAL REWARDS$110,600 – 128,600 annual salaryMines takes into consideration a combination of candidate’s education, training and experience as well as the position’s scope and complexity, the discretion and latitude required in the role, work location, and external market and internal value when determining a salary level for potential new employees.Colorado School of Mines offers a robust portfolio of benefits for all employees. For this role, that includes:Fully paid health and dental premiumsGenerous sick/vacation time: 13 paid holidays per year – including a week-long winter break for entire campus.Fully vested retirement plan on first day of employment, with generous employer contributionTuition benefits (6 credits per year for employees, 50 percent discount for dependents)Free RTD Ecopass
All Mines employees also have access to discount programs through the State of Colorado and free tickets for Mines Athletics home games, as well as access to the on-campus Recreation Center (fitness classes and training, swimming pool and more), equipment rentals through the Outdoor Rec Center, the Colorado State Employee Assistance Program (CSEAP), and backup child and elder care. Coming soon is an on-campus daycare center. For more information about benefits at Mines, go to mines.edu/human-resources/benefits.
HOW TO APPLYApplicants must:Complete an online application (personal information, demographic information, veteran status) here: https://mines.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/Mines_Careers/job/Colorado/Manager-of-Applications_JR104193.Upload a resume or CVUpload a cover letter
This posting will close May 5, 2024 at 11:59. Applications may not be accepted after that date. Application review will begin May 6, 2024. We anticipate a start date for this position of July 1, 2024. 
References will not be contacted until later in the selection process and you will be informed before that contact is made.
Mines welcomes everyone to our team; in your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc). If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.
Successful Completion of a Background Investigation is Required for this Position.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
